It is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or white. The plant possesses a unique adaptation of having tiny, scale-like leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Its flowers emit a mild fragrance, which attracts specific pollinators such as moths and beetles. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ophthalmoblapton parviflorum is considered a vulnerable species.
